message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper addresses the problem of language-based temporal localization in untrimmed videos, which involves both computer vision and natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a novel method that mines activity concepts from both video and language modalities, which involves machine learning and data mining techniques. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.MM (Multimedia) are also likely categories. Additionally, the paper uses activity classifiers' prediction scores to encode visual concepts, which involves artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely category. Finally, the paper evaluates its method on two datasets and compares it to state-of-the-art methods, which involves statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible category as well.
